summary: Internal American Express email chain regarding a $2 million High-Yield Personal Savings account belonging to Jeffrey Epstein. A manager in the Financial Intelligence Unit inquires if a freeze order will be sent for the account, and a colleague responds that no freeze order will be sent, allowing the funds to be released.

persons.name: Kristina Lee Hendrickson
persons.role: Manager - Growth Assignment Lead, Special Investigations, Financial Intelligence Unit, Global Financial Crimes Compliance at American Express
persons.context: American Express employee who initiates an email inquiry about whether a freeze order will be placed on Jeffrey Epstein's $2 million savings account.

persons.name: Tara J Frazier
persons.context: Copied on an internal American Express email regarding the decision not to freeze Jeffrey Epstein's account.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The owner of a High-Yield Personal Savings account at American Express containing $2 million, which is the subject of the internal compliance discussion.

connections.description: Hendrickson, as a compliance manager at American Express, is inquiring about the status of a freeze order on Epstein's financial account.
Colleagues at American Exchange copied on an internal compliance email regarding Epstein's account.

events.title: American Express internal inquiry on Epstein account freeze
events.description: An American Express manager in the Financial Intelligence Unit emails colleagues to determine if a freeze order will be sent for a $2 million account belonging to Jeffrey Epstein. A response indicates no freeze order will be sent, allowing funds to be released.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein held a High-Yield Personal Savings account at American Express containing $2 million as of July 2019.
American Express's Financial Intelligence Unit internally discussed whether to place a freeze order on Epstein's account.
The decision was made not to send a freeze order, which would result in the funds being released.
